title.narrative: Regional Communications Infrastructure Program Phase 5 - Uganda

description.narrative:
To support the Recipient's efforts to:
(i) lower prices for international capacity and extend the geographic reach of broadband networks (the connectivity development objective); and
(ii) improve the Government’s efficiency and transparency through e-Government applications (the transparency development objective).

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of ICT and National Guidance
Republic of Uganda - Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development

condition.narrative: Automated Accounting System: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, cause the ProjectImplementing Entity to automate its accounting system in a form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Environmental Specialist: The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, cause the ProjectImplementing Entity to recruit an Environmental Specialist on a retainer basis with qualifications, experience and terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association.

Financial Management Training: The Recipient shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to provide to its Project ImplementationOffice training on Bank financial management guidelines and procedures, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, allin a form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Funding of e-Procurement Operational Costs (recurrent): The Recipient shall allocate sufficient funding within PPDA's annual budget- starting in Fiscal Year 2016/2017 - for operational costs related to e-Procurement to ensure sustainability.

Management Contract for NBI (recurrent): The Recipient shall maintain - or cause to be maintained - the existing private sectormanagement contract or other PPP arrangement satisfactory to the Association for the Recipient's national fiber optic backbonenetwork.

Procurement Filing and Record Keeping: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, cause theProject Implementing Entity to update its procurement filing and record keeping system, in form and substance acceptable to theAssociation.

Procurement Specialist: The Recipient shall, not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, cause the Project ImplementingEntity to recruit a procurement specialist, with qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

Procurement Training: The Recipient shall, not later than twelve (12) months after the Effective Date, cause the ProjectImplementing Entity to provide procurement training for staff of its procurement and disposal unit in a manner and substancesatisfactory to the Association.

Project Accountant: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, cause the Project ImplementingEntity to recruit a Project accountant with qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

Social Scientist: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, cause the Project ImplementingEntity to recruit a Social Scientist on a retainer basis with qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation.

e-Government Public Service Delivery Platform Utilization: The Recipient shall, not later than two (2) years after the EffectiveDate, adopt policy and regulation, satisfactory to the Association, to mandate MDAs to utilize the shared e-Government publicservice delivery platform once it is set up.
